page.title: 09Top Farm & Hatcliffe Top
page.content: Hatcliffe Top and Top Farm are owned by the same owners. The present owners have lived at Top Farm for 15 years.the use of the land has changed over the years from mainly grassland and woodland to an arable and sheep farm splet. The crops grown at the farm are wheat, barley and also oil seed rape. The owners keep 9 tups and 300 ewes. The owners need less labour than in the years gone by but do employ extra labour for harvest, sheep dipping and clipping and also roguing. They keep four horses and two ponies. Hatcliffe Top is where all the lambs and sheep are kept and at Hatcliffe Top there are three gouses. The owners fear for the future is that they are over producing cereals.
